p: Chowdhury et al. [ 136] investigated the essential oil chemical profile of different M. spicata varieties from Bangladesh, and found (âˆ’)-carvone and limonene as major constituents, with these data having been recently confirmed by Dwivedy et al. [ 100]. For Mentha diemenica essential oil, collected in Queensland (Australia), menthone, neomenthyl acetate and pulegone were found to be the main compounds present, while essential oil of the same species from Canada had significantly higher amounts of pulegone, clearly supporting it as the main compound, followed by menthone and isomenthone, with neomenthyl acetate not being found [ 103].
